Remarks_on_decisions: is Bayesian clustering and admixture analysis a stat anlaysis? I would say no for those, however, they performed some model selection based on AIC, which might be bioinformatics-independent, and a test named Templeton which implements a Wilcoxon signed-rank test to determine whether one tree topology is significantly more parsimonious than another. That is, it could be considered as yes, statistics on the basis of that. Not sure though.
